input.description: The timeout value is seconds. This is the time after which the command will timeout regardless of whether the command execution is complete or not.
alert id[Required] The ID of the alert that will be returned to the user.
operator[Required] The 'operator' tag specified under 'criteria-expression specifies the operand for alert id specified. Valid values - equals, not equals, like, in,greater than,less than

xslt-stylesheet.stylesheet: <xsl:stylesheet xmlns:xsl="http://www.w3.org/1999/XSL/Transform" version="1.0"> <xsl:output indent="no" /> <xsl:template match="/"> <items> <item> <operation-name> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">get-alert-by-id</xsl:text> </operation-name> <xsl:if test="string('${timeout secs}') != ''"> <timeout-secs> <xsl:value-of select="string('${timeout secs}')" disable-output-escaping="no" /> </timeout-secs> </xsl:if> <command-parameters> <alert-search-criteria> <criteria-expression> <key> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">Id</xsl:text> </key> <value> <xsl:value-of select=" string('${alert id}')" disable-output-escaping="no" /> </value> <operator> <xsl:value-of select="string('${operator}')" disable-output-escaping="no" /> </operator> </criteria-expression> </alert-search-criteria> </command-parameters> </item> </items> </xsl:template> </xsl:stylesheet>

documentation.description: Utility to create items xml for the process - "Find Alert By ID"
